activities.name: King's Day (Koningsdag)
activities.description: Join the nationwide celebration! Delft fills with orange outfits, street parties, flea markets ('vrijmarkt'), and music, especially around the Markt and Beestenmarkt.
activities.seasonal_notes: Celebrated annually on April 27th (or 26th if 27th is a Sunday). Expect crowds and a festive atmosphere.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for street events. Wear orange! Public transport may run on a modified schedule.

activities.name: Canal Boat Tours Season Opening
activities.description: Enjoy a relaxing boat tour through Delft's historic canals as the season reopens, offering unique views of the city's architecture.
activities.seasonal_notes: Boat tours typically resume in March or April. Check operator websites for exact dates and schedules.
activities.booking_tips: Book online or at the departure points. Weekends can be busy, especially with good weather.

activities.name: Keukenhof Gardens Day Trip
activities.description: Visit the world-famous Keukenhof Gardens (near Lisse) to see millions of tulips and spring flowers in bloom. Easily accessible from Delft.
activities.seasonal_notes: Open mid-March to mid-May. Peak bloom varies but is often mid-April.
activities.booking_tips: Book transport (e.g., bus from Leiden/Schiphol) and entry tickets well in advance, especially during peak season and holidays.

activities.name: Terrace Season Opening
activities.description: Experience the Dutch 'terrasjes' culture as cafes and bars open their outdoor seating areas. Enjoy drinks and snacks by the canals or on squares like Beestenmarkt.
activities.seasonal_notes: Terraces open as weather permits, usually becoming consistently popular from April onwards.
activities.booking_tips: Popular spots fill up quickly on sunny days. No reservations usually needed for casual drinks.

activities.name: Delft Flower Market
activities.description: Browse vibrant spring flowers, plants, and bulbs at the weekly markets (especially Saturday market on Brabantse Turfmarkt/Burgwal).
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the best selection of tulips and other seasonal flowers.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for the best choice. Bring cash, although some vendors accept cards.

activities.name: Oude Delft Antiques & Curiosities Market
activities.description: Stroll along the canals (Hippolytusbuurt area) browsing antiques, books, art, and collectibles at this charming summer market.
activities.seasonal_notes: Runs weekly on Saturdays from April to October. Very picturesque setting.
activities.booking_tips: Popular event, can get crowded. Good for unique finds and atmosphere.

activities.name: Delft Chamber Music Festival
activities.description: Enjoy high-quality classical chamber music performances in beautiful historic venues like the Van der Mandelezaal (Prinsenhof).
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held late July / early August. Features international artists.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance via the festival website, popular concerts sell out.

activities.name: Outdoor Dining & Drinks (Terraces)
activities.description: Peak season for enjoying Delft's many canal-side and square terraces (Markt, Beestenmarkt). Relax with drinks or a meal outdoors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Long summer evenings make terrace hopping popular. Beestenmarkt is particularly lively.
activities.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for dinner, especially on popular terraces.

activities.name: Day Trip to Scheveningen Beach
activities.description: Take the tram (Line 1) directly from Delft to The Hague's famous beach resort, Scheveningen, for sunbathing, swimming, beach bars, and the pier.
activities.seasonal_notes: Best on warm, sunny days. Can be very busy during heatwaves.
activities.booking_tips: Buy a day ticket for the tram. Allow ample travel time on peak days.

activities.name: Explore Delftse Hout
activities.description: Visit the large recreational park just outside the city center for walking, cycling, swimming (in the lake), and picnicking.
activities.seasonal_notes: Popular local spot for outdoor activities in summer.
activities.booking_tips: Easily reachable by bike. Check water quality notices before swimming.

activities.name: Cultural Season Opening
activities.description: Theatres (e.g., Theater de Veste) and music venues launch their new season programs with diverse performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: September marks the start of the main cultural season.
activities.booking_tips: Check venue websites for programs and book tickets in advance for popular shows.

activities.name: Bokbier Season
activities.description: Sample seasonal 'Herfstbok' (autumn bock beer) in Delft's traditional pubs and specialty beer bars like De Klomp or Locus Publicus.
activities.seasonal_notes: Bokbier becomes widely available from late September/October. Many bars have special Bokbier events.
activities.booking_tips: Ask bartenders for recommendations. Some bars offer tasting flights.

activities.name: Cozy Pub Visits ('Bruin Cafés')
activities.description: Enjoy the warm, traditional atmosphere of Delft's 'brown cafes' (historic pubs) on cooler autumn evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect time to experience the cozy 'gezelligheid' of Dutch pubs.
activities.booking_tips: Generally no reservations needed for drinks. Try local snacks ('borrelhapjes').

activities.name: Museum Visits
activities.description: Explore Delft's museums like the Prinsenhof, Vermeer Centrum, or Royal Delft factory on cooler or rainy autumn days.
activities.seasonal_notes: Museums are often less crowded than in peak summer season.
activities.booking_tips: Check opening hours. Online booking can sometimes offer discounts or skip lines.

activities.name: TU Delft Campus Exploration
activities.description: Explore the university campus with its striking modern architecture as the academic year gets underway.
activities.seasonal_notes: Campus is active with students and researchers. Autumn foliage adds color.
activities.booking_tips: Take a walk or cycle around. Check for any public lectures or events.

activities.name: Lichtjesavond (Light Evening)
activities.description: Delft's beloved winter event where thousands of lights illuminate the city center, Christmas trees are lit, and there's music, market stalls, and festive cheer.
activities.seasonal_notes: A major highlight of Delft's winter calendar. Expect very large crowds.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early. Use public transport as city center access is restricted. Dress warmly.

activities.name: Sinterklaas Arrival (Intocht)
activities.description: Experience the Dutch tradition as Sinterklaas (St. Nicholas) arrives in Delft by boat, followed by a parade through the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: A festive event, especially for children, marking the start of the Sinterklaas season leading up to Dec 5th.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official route and timings. Arrive early for a good viewing spot along the canals or parade route.

activities.name: Christmas Markets & Shopping
activities.description: Browse festive stalls selling gifts, food, and glühwein (mulled wine) at smaller Christmas markets and enjoy holiday shopping in the decorated city center.
activities.seasonal_notes: Markets often pop up on specific weekends. Shops have extended hours leading up to Christmas.
activities.booking_tips: Check local listings for specific market dates and locations.

activities.name: Ice Skating (Potential)
activities.description: Sometimes a temporary ice skating rink is set up, often on the Markt square or near the station, during the winter months.
activities.seasonal_notes: Availability varies year to year; check local announcements closer to winter.
activities.booking_tips: If available, skate rental is usually offered onsite.

activities.name: Oliebollen & Winter Treats
activities.description: Sample traditional Dutch winter treats like 'oliebollen' (doughnuts) and 'appelflappen' (apple fritters) from street stalls, especially around New Year.
activities.seasonal_notes: Oliebollen stalls ('oliebollenkramen') appear throughout the city in late autumn/winter.
activities.booking_tips: Look for stalls near shopping areas or markets. Best enjoyed warm!
